## Q2 {.unnumbered}

Convert each mixed number into an improper fraction.

2.1. $\displaystyle \quad 1\dfrac{1}{2}$

2.2. $\displaystyle \quad -2\dfrac{2}{3}$

2.3. $\displaystyle \quad 3\dfrac{1}{4}$

2.4. $\displaystyle \quad -5\dfrac{2}{5}$

2.5. $\displaystyle \quad 4\dfrac{3}{7}$

2.6. $\displaystyle \quad 6\dfrac{1}{6}$

2.7. $\displaystyle \quad -8\dfrac{3}{5}$

2.8. $\displaystyle \quad 10\dfrac{2}{9}$

2.9. $\displaystyle \quad -7\dfrac{5}{11}$

2.10. $\displaystyle \quad 12\dfrac{3}{4}$

## Q3 {.unnumbered}

3.1. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{5}{2}$

3.3. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{10}{3}$

3.4. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{-11}{7}$

3.5. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{12}{6}$

3.6. $\displaystyle \quad -\dfrac{25}{6}$

3.7. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{31}{9}$

3.8. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{50}{11}$

3.9. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{64}{-8}$

3.10. $\displaystyle \quad -\dfrac{100}{13}$

## Q4 {.unnumbered}

Find the missing value $?$ that makes the two fractions equivalent.

4.1. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{1}{4} = \dfrac{?}{12}$

4.2. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{2}{3} = \dfrac{6}{?}$

4.3. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{3}{5} = \dfrac{?}{25}$

4.4. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{5}{8} = \dfrac{?}{16}$

4.5. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{3}{4} = \dfrac{?}{-20}$

4.6. $\displaystyle \quad -\dfrac{1}{6} = \dfrac{?}{24}$

4.7. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{5}{8} = \dfrac{20}{?}$

4.8. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{4}{3} = \dfrac{?}{18}$

4.9. $\displaystyle \quad -\dfrac{1}{3} = \dfrac{?}{27}$

4.10. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{7}{10} = \dfrac{70}{?}$

4.11. $\displaystyle \quad -\dfrac{4}{5} = \dfrac{?}{30}$

4.12. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{11}{12} = \dfrac{?}{60}$

4.13. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{3}{-7} = \dfrac{?}{21}$

4.14. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{8}{9} = \dfrac{32}{?}$

4.15. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{6}{7} = -\dfrac{?}{-49}$

## Q6 {.unnumbered}

6.2. $\displaystyle \quad 2\dfrac{2}{8}$

6.3. $\displaystyle \quad \dfrac{12}{10}$
